Author: DragonPup

Comment: Absolute game changer. While it's not a guaranteed win for Ossoff, it's going to be a challenge to beat him now. If Warnock could win in what should've been a red wave year (2022), what should be a blue wave year will hit even harder with Trump's economic impact. Ossoff can win, and so can Warnock win *another* full term in 2028.  If it wasn't obvious, Dems need to defend these key seats, yes - especially also Michigan, which went red in 2024. But they also need to expand their pool. I've seen emails saying they're only targeting NC and Maine. They gotta think bigger and expand to Alaska (Alaska keeps hitting back at MAGA in favor of moderates, and Dan Sullivan is MAGA; Tom Begich III or Mary Peltola could win that seat, while whichever doesn't run for that one can win back at the at-large seat from Nick Begich). Let's not waste time on other nonsense (I keep seeing Tennessee and such in the mix); of course, run people, but let's not be dumb. Of course, run Sherrod Brown for the Ohio special and run Jon Tester for the Montana special. We can make bigger gains than Dems seemed to be resigned to think we're capable of.
